p: On the other hand, some biopesticides can show low persistence (something positive) but they can also be considered as a drawback after application [ 79] because essential oils can suffer gradual biodegradation of their active substances after application [ 76]. Related to this, essential oil-based pesticides present less effective when they are compared with other synthetic/conventional chemical pesticides [ 75, 77]. Finally, these kinds of pesticides generally require higher application rates, which together with the need to apply the product frequently, makes their use expensive and time-consuming [ 75].
